org.lwjgl.system

Class MemoryUtil.BufferAllocator

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.lwjgl.system.MemoryUtil.BufferAllocator
  • Enclosing class:
    MemoryUtil

    public abstract static class MemoryUtil.BufferAllocator
extends java.lang.Object
    Implementations of this class can be passed to APIs that support configurable memory allocators.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static MemoryUtil.BufferAllocator MALLOC
      Allocates memory using MemoryUtil.memAlloc(int).
      static MemoryUtil.BufferAllocator NIO
      Allocates memory using BufferUtils, i.e.
      static MemoryUtil.BufferAllocator STACK
      Allocates memory using MemoryStack.malloc(int).

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      abstract java.nio.ByteBuffer allocate(int size)
      Allocates a ByteBuffer with capacity equal to size.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • NIO

        public static final MemoryUtil.BufferAllocator NIO
        Allocates memory using BufferUtils, i.e. ByteBuffer.allocateDirect(int).

      • MALLOC

        public static final MemoryUtil.BufferAllocator MALLOC
        Allocates memory using MemoryUtil.memAlloc(int).

        ByteBuffer instances allocated using this allocator must be explicitly freed using MemoryUtil.memFree(java.nio.Buffer).

      • STACK

        public static final MemoryUtil.BufferAllocator STACK
        Allocates memory using MemoryStack.malloc(int).

        The thread-local stack is used. Before this allocator is used, at least one frame must be pushed to the stack.

    • Method Detail

      • allocate

        public abstract java.nio.ByteBuffer allocate(int size)
        Allocates a ByteBuffer with capacity equal to size.
        Parameters:
        size - the buffer capacity
        Returns:
        the allocated ByteBuffer
